intro: Vigna glabra var. angustifolia, commonly known as slender cowpea, is an annual legume native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into cylindrical, dehiscent pods containing several angular seeds. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a valuable crop in arid environments. This variety is often cultivated for its edible seeds, which are rich in protein and nutrients.
